sub_topic: Solving homogeneous systems of linear equations
message_1:
Solve the following system of homogeneous linear equations using matrix method:

x + 4y - 3z = 0 

2x - y + 5z = 0 

3x + 2y + z = 0
message_2:
To solve the given system of homogeneous linear equations using the matrix method, we first write the given system in the matrix form AX = 0, where A is the coefficient matrix, X is the column matrix of variables, and 0 is the zero matrix.

A = | 1  4 -3 |
    | 2 -1  5 |
    | 3  2  1 |

X = | x |
    | y |
    | z |

0 = | 0 |
    | 0 |
    | 0 |

Now, we find the determinant of matrix A.

det(A) = 1(-1 - 10) - 4(2 - 15) - 3(4 + 3)
       = 1(11) - 4(-13) - 3(7)
       = 11 + 52 - 21
       = 42

Since the determinant of matrix A is non-zero, the given system of homogeneous linear equations has a unique solution.

Next, we find the inverse of matrix A using the formula A^(-1) = (1/det(A)) * adj(A), where adj(A) is the adjoint of matrix A.

First, we find the adjoint of matrix A.

adj(A) = | (-1 - 10)  (2 - 15)  (4 + 3)  |
         | (10 - 5)   (3 - 6)   (6 - 4)  |
         | (2 + 5)    (5 - 12)  (1 - 8)  |

adj(A) = | -11  13  7  |
         |  5  -3  2  |
         |  7  -7 -7  |

Now, we find the inverse of matrix A.

A^(-1) = (1/42) * adj(A)

A^(-1) = | -11/42  13/42  7/42  |
         |  5/42  -3/42  2/42  |
         |  7/42  -7/42 -7/42  |

Finally, we find the solution of the given system of homogeneous linear equations by multiplying A^(-1) with the zero matrix.

X = A^(-1) * 0

X = | -11/42  13/42  7/42  | * | 0 |
    |  5/42  -3/42  2/42  |   | 0 |
    |  7/42  -7/42 -7/42  |   | 0 |

X = | 0 |
    | 0 |
    | 0 |

So, the unique solution of the given system of homogeneous linear equations is x = 0, y = 0, and z = 0.
